alert.note: Alert for Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A band of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo and northwestern Cameron Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the strongest thunderstorm over Chateau Heights, or over South McAllen, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mission, Pharr, Weslaco, San Juan, Alamo, Donna, Mercedes, Hidalgo, Elsa and Progreso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
